result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Marinko #485476 Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Court Reporter Chris Champeau, Feb.10, 2016 hearing

11:05-11:45.   Defendant Daniel J Marinko  #485476 in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by both parties.  Statement by Mr. Marinko.  Court will impose 3 1/2 years prison with 1 year 6 months initial and 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.  Not eligible for Challenge or Substance Abuse Program. Terms of extended supervision will be Obtain a mental health assessment and follow through with the treatment recommendation.  Complete cognitive behavioral therapy programming.  If available, complete a trauma informed care group.  Maintain fulltime employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Payment of all court obligations and supervision fees.  Not possess illegal controlled substance unless with a valid prescription. DNA surcharge and DNA sample unless already submitted.   Costs of $518.00 and DNA sample to be given.  Dismiss traffic matters.  0 days jail credit.
